title: Bug 49195: Using 1 as shutdown port with Windows service works, but prints error message
description: Specify <Server port="1" in server.xml. That can be used to differentiate the two use cases. There could be improvements on how to stop Tomcat. System.exit(0) would work regardless of all that. I suppose that jsvc may show the same behavior, but I have not tried.
OB: When using 1 as the shutdown port with the Windows service, Tomcat works as expected and shuts down properly. However, an error message is displayed.
EB: It would be better if the error message was not displayed when using 1 as the shutdown port with the Windows service.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Specify <Server port="1" in the server.xml
2. Run Tomcat as a Windows service
3. Attempt to shut down the Tomcat service using the shutdown port
